Package pulse.baseline

Class Baseline

  • java.lang.Object
    • pulse.util.UpwardsNavigable
      • pulse.util.Group
        • pulse.util.Accessible
          • pulse.util.PropertyHolder
            • pulse.baseline.Baseline
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Optimisable, Descriptive, Reflexive
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FlatBaseline
    public abstract class Baseline
extends PropertyHolder
implements Reflexive, Optimisable
    An abstract class for baseline calculations. Defines an abstract valueAt method that would return a baseline value at a given moment in time (either before or after the laser pulse). The baseline parameters can be modified within an optimisation loop, hence there are two abstract methods to implement that functionality.
    See Also:
    HeatingCurve, SearchTask, IndexedVector

      • valueAt

        public abstract double valueAt​(double x)
        Calculates the baseline at the given position.
        Parameters:
        x - the position on the profile (e.g., the time value)
        Returns:
        the baseline value

      • fitTo

        public void fitTo​(ExperimentalData data,
                  double rangeMin,
                  double rangeMax)
        Selects part of the data that can be used for baseline estimation (typically, this means selecting 'negative' time values and the corresponding signal) data and runs the fitting algorithms,
        Parameters:
        data - the experimental data
        rangeMin - the minimum of the time range
        rangeMax - the maximum of the time range

      • fitTo

        public void fitTo​(ExperimentalData data)
        Calls fitTo using the default time range for the data: -Infinity < t < ZERO_LEFT, where the upper bound is a small negative constant.
        Parameters:
        data - the experimental data stretching to negative time values
        See Also:
        fitTo(pulse.input.ExperimentalData,double,double)
